meanings.definition: A distinct form or race of a plant or animal species occupying a particular habitat.
meanings.sent1: The ecotypes of birds in the forest have different colored feathers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how ecotypes of fish survive in different water temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The ecotypes of flowers in the garden had a party and invited bees as guests.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the ecotypes of ants are like different teams competing for food.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypes of trees in the swamp stood tall and proud, each one unique in its adaptation.

meanings.definition: A genetically distinct population within a species that is adapted to a specific environment.
meanings.sent1: The ecotypes of wolves in the snowy mountains have thicker fur for warmth.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying how ecotypes of bacteria develop resistance to antibiotics.
meanings.sent3: The ecotypes of squirrels in the park organized a race to see who could gather the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, the ecotypes of smartphones compete for the title of most advanced.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypes of fish in the deep sea have evolved unique features to survive in the darkness.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms that are adapted to a particular set of environmental conditions.
meanings.sent1: The ecotypes of plants in the desert have adapted to thrive with minimal water.
meanings.sent2: Ecologists study how ecotypes of insects interact with different types of soil.
meanings.sent3: The ecotypes of birds in the park organized a singing competition to attract mates.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the ecotypes of clothing styles change with each season.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypes of bacteria in the human gut play a crucial role in digestion.
